newsitem.title: THAILAND: Thai stocks seen down, awaiting more Q1 earnings.
newsitem.headline: Thai stocks seen down, awaiting more Q1 earnings.

text.p: Thai stocks were expected to continue falling slightly on Monday as investors awaited first quarter results of listed firms," brokers said.

"The market is expected to remain bearish as investors are waiting for first quarter earnings while at the same time they want to stay on the sidelines due to a market holiday later this week," said a broker at a foreign brokerage.
The stock market will be closed on Thursday for the Labour Day holiday.
The SET index ended 4.42 points, or 0.64 percent down at 684.00 on Friday. The SET-50 fell 0.53 point, or 1.02 percent to end at 51.36. Turnover was 2.69 billion baht.
